nodes.text: It looks like a regular desk.
Heart-stopping. And do you also happen to know what function I serve here?
Yes... you're the Librarian. Obviously.
You're extraordinarily perceptive today! Perhaps you should quit now while you're ahead, yes?
It's a nice desk.
A nice desk? Is that the extent of your observational vocabulary? Perhaps you could be a bit less generic and more descriptive the next time you attempt to communicate with me.
It's a very nice desk!
It looks like a regular desk... it has a bunch of big drawers, nothing fancy. Well-worn. There is folder full of papers on the top.
Sophia is going to be really disappointed to hear about all this... nothing. Maybe I should just invent something interesting so she isn't as bored with it as I was.

nodes.message: From Sophia convo: "When I checked out his desk, all I found was office supplies and book repair set. There was nothing personal."

nodes.text: Okay Mr. Snooty Librarian, time to see if your story checks out!
So what does the Librarian hide in his desk?
There's some old books, a folder of paper, an ink pot, and a vase with fragrant mint in it. I guess the Librarian gets tired of the smell of old books.
These books are in terrible condition. The pages are practically falling out.
Maybe that's what he does with all the weird stuff in the bottom drawer? It's a librarian's job to keep the books in working order.
Seems like an awful lot of work, though. I can see why he gets so touchy about people mistreating them.
Maybe the Librarian secretly hates books, and he's systematically ripping them apart when no one is looking?
... probably not. That'd be much too interesting for him.
Maybe one of these books is actually an account of his illicit misdeeds!
This one is just a misplaced biography of some kind... "The Art of the Steal". Hey! That actually sounds useful!

Darn, this isn't useful at all. The author just keeps saying how amazing and wonderful this guy was without ever giving examples or even reasons. "He made the best steals." - what does that even mean?!
This is a damaged book... "Where the Red Urn Glows". It's a novel about a boy and his two Doggie friends on a quest for a ruby urn. This tells me nothing about the Librarian, though...
The rest of the books are too fragile to flip through. I'd better not touch them.
Boy, his handwriting is tiny and neat. I need a magnifying glass to really read this.
The papers all seem to be on which books need mending or replacing. How boring can that be?
Let's see... there's actually not much in here. A couple ink wells, some basic looking quills, and a stack of blank parchment.
I know! There's gotta be a false bottom or secret compartment! I'll just knock around here...
No... I guess not.

nodes.message: Block for searching Big bottom Drawer

nodes.text: Oh! Look at this mysterious leather case! I bet it's full of nefarious devices!
It has some brushes, scissors, a small wooden plank... a few leather strips, a small craft blade...
Ooo, and there's some gooey! He won't miss just a bit...
I guess this explains the damaged books on his desk. He uses this stuff to repair them as part of his job.
Seems like an awful lot of work, though. I can see why he gets so touchy about people mistreating them.
I wonder what all this is for? Perhaps he partakes in demonic papercraft?!
Or maybe scrapbooking. Either way, it's bad news.
I really hoped to find something juicy here, but the Librarian apparently has no personal life at all. How dull!
